text.p: These are some of the main stories in Sofia newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- Bulgaria's cabinet will propose to parliament to peg the lev at 1,000 per mark as an anchor currency in a currency board arrangement, to be introduced from July 1, Finance Minister Muravei Radev said.
-- The Bulgarian National Bank said it had allowed private Bulgaria insurance holding to buy the ailing state-owned Yambol bank, in receivership since September, for 3.8 billion levs. @
-- The American C & H Enterprises is interested in investing some $10 in Bulgarian Black Sea holiday resorts, Bulgaria's Trade ministry officials said.

-- Bulgaria's parliament is expected to approve amendments to the Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) Act to make currency board operational and elect a new BNB governor by the end of this week, budget commission chairman Yordan Tsonev said.

-- Bulgaria's former interim finance minister Svetoslav Gavriiski has agreed to head the Bulgarian National Bank when a currency board is introduced in the country next month, Prime minister Ivan Kostov said.
-- The Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) foreign exchange reserves rose to $1.28 billion in May from $1.146 billion a month earlier, BNB governor Lyubomir Filipov said.
-- Bulgaria's tobacco output is seen raising to 65,000 tonnes this year from 39,790 tonnes last year, Tobacco Producers' Union said.
-- Bulgaria's Securities and Stock Exchange Comission is expected to discuss on Wednesday the Bulgarian Stock Exchange's (BSE) application for a licence, BSE director Viktor Papazov said.
-- Bulgaria's Justice ministry is preparing draft legislation against tax evasion by owners of luxurious real estate property and cars, Justice minister Vassil Gotsev said. @

-- Bulgaria's police said it would boost measures to fight corruption within their ranks and white-collar crime in the country by employing qualified young experts in economics, law and computer technology.

-- Bulgaria's volatile striker Hristo Stoichkov who plays for Barcelona submitted an offer by the Spanish company Convoy Solidaritoa Bulgaria to invest some $600 million in completion of the Sofia underground railway system, Sofia mayor Stefan Sofianski said.
